text: But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and domestic animals that were with him in the ark. God caused a wind to blow over the earth and the waters receded.

The <st data-num="04599" class="">fountains</st> of the <st data-num="08415" class="">deep</st> and the <st data-num="0699" class="">floodgates</st> of <st data-num="08064" class="">heaven</st> were <st data-num="05534" class="">closed</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="01653" class="">rain</st> <st data-num="03607" class="">stopped falling</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="08064" class="">sky</st>.

The <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">kept</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">receding</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">steadily</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>, so that <st data-num="04325" class="">they</st><n id="2" /> had <st data-num="02637" class="">gone down</st><n id="3" /> by the <st data-num="07097" class="">end</st> of the <st data-num="03967 02572">150</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>.

On the <st data-num="07651 06240">seventeenth</st> <st data-num="03117 02320">day</st> of the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>, the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st> <st data-num="05117" class="">came to rest</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> one of the <st data-num="02022" class="">mountains</st> of <st data-num="0780" class="">Ararat</st>.<n id="1" />
The waters kept on receding until the tenth month. On the first day of the tenth month, the tops of the mountains became visible.
At the end of 40 days, Noah opened the window he had made in the ark
and sent out a raven; it kept flying back and forth until the waters had dried up on the earth.
Then Noah sent out a dove to see if the waters had receded from the surface of the ground.

The <st data-num="03123" class="">dove</st> could <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">find</st> a <st data-num="04494" class="">resting place</st> for its <st data-num="03709 07272">feet</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> still <st data-num="05921" class="">covered</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06440" class="">surface</st> of the <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>, and so it <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> Noah<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st>. He <st data-num="07971" class="">stretched out</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the dove,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> it <st data-num="0413" class="">back</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st>.<n id="4" />

He <st data-num="02342" class="">waited</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="05750 0312">more</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> and then <st data-num="07971" class="">sent out</st> the <st data-num="03123" class="">dove</st> <st data-num="03254" class="">again</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st>.

When<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03123" class="">dove</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">returned</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him <st data-num="06256" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>, <st data-num="02009" class="">there</st> was<n id="2" /> a <st data-num="02965" class="">freshly plucked</st> <st data-num="02132" class="">olive</st> <st data-num="05929" class="">leaf</st> in its <st data-num="06310" class="">beak</st>! <st data-num="05146" class="">Noah</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">knew</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> had <st data-num="07043" class="">receded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>.
He waited another seven days and sent the dove out again, but it did not return to him this time.

In Noah’s six hundred and first year, in the first day of the first month, the waters had dried up from the earth, and Noah removed the covering from the ark and saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
And by the twenty-seventh day of the second month the earth was dry.
Then God spoke to Noah and said,

“<st data-num="03318" class="">Come out</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="08392" class="">ark</st>, <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st>, your <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>, your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>, and your <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>’ <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you.

Bring out with you all the living creatures that are with you. Bring out every living thing, including the birds, animals, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth. Let them increase and be fruitful and multiply on the earth!”
Noah went out along with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.
Every living creature, every creeping thing, every bird, and everything that moves on the earth went out of the ark in their groups.
Noah built an altar to the Lord. He then took some of every kind of clean animal and clean bird and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

And the Lord smelled the soothing aroma and said to himself, “I will never again curse the ground because of humankind, even though the inclination of their minds is evil from childhood on. I will never again destroy everything that lives, as I have just done.

“While the earth continues to exist,

planting time and harvest,

cold and heat,

summer and winter,

and day and night will not cease.”
